questions.question_text: Which ports are affected by enabling BPDU Guard globally?

discussion.content: When you enable this BPDU Guard command globally, the command applies only to spanning tree edge ports.
The Anycast/MSDP mechanism used to provide redundancy in sparse-mode is not an option for Bidir.
A is correct. The provided link is quite clear about that.

questions.question_text: Which way to configure a redundant rendezvous point for BIDIR multicast are valid?

discussion.content:
Guy! the correct answers are B and F. Forget my other two comments if they got submitted =D

B. serial number of each APIC in the cluster
F. admin status of each APIC in the cluster

The below example waits until the cluster is fully-fit. In this example you know the number of APICs in the cluster and you verify each APIC reports a ‘fully-fit’ status.
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/scenario_guides/guide_aci.html

B. serial number of each APIC in the cluster
E. number of network interfaces of each APIC

The below example waits until the cluster is fully-fit. In this example you know the number of APICs in the cluster and you verify each APIC reports a ‘fully-fit’ status.
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/scenario_guides/guide_aci.html

B. serial number of each APIC in the cluster
E. number of network interfaces of each APIC

The below example waits until the cluster is fully-fit. In this example you know the number of APICs in the cluster and you verify each APIC reports a ‘fully-fit’ status.
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/scenario_guides/guide_aci.html


F. admin status of each APIC in the cluster

choices.D: ports of the leaves where the APICs are connected.
choices.A: APIC version installed on each node
choices.C: hard disks status for each APIC in the cluster
choices.E: number of network interfaces of each APIC
choices.B: serial number of each APIC in the cluster
choices.F: admin status of each APIC in the cluster DE

choices.A: Enabling the infrastructure VLAN on an AEP is a mandatory requirement when this AEP is associated to any VMM domain.
choices.D: AEPs are directly bound to spine and leaf switch profiles and are then associated indirectly to interface selectors.
choices.C: AEPs are an optional component to ACI access port configuration that ease the burden of configuring multiple individual policies.
choices.E: The attached entity profile provides a template to deploy hypervisor policies on a large set of leaf ports.
choices.B: AEP provides the association of a virtual machine management domain and the physical network infrastructure.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about attachable access entity profiles in the ACI Fabric are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A is what I think too with the Hypervisor info provided

D is wrong. The number of displayed tenants (26) includes the 3 default tenants plus 23 user defined tenants. 

So I think A is the correct answer.

choices.B: Integrated Layer 4 "" Layer 7 services are not in use.
choices.D: The number of user-defined tenants is 26.
choices.C: Too many endpoints are connected to nodes 121 and 122.
choices.A: This fabric configured for VMM integration.
choices.E: The capacity information shown is typical of multipod deployments.
